metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000205 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
U-Boot contains a CWE-20: Improper Input Validation vulnerability in Verified boot signature validation that can result in Bypass verified boot. This attack appear to be exploitable via Specially crafted FIT image and special device memory functionality.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000205` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

u-boot - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-amlogic - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-exynos - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-imx - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-omap - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-qcom - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-rockchip - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-rpi - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-sunxi - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-tegra - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
u-boot-tools - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> verified boot not used in Ubuntu, setting as "negligible"

criterions.comment: u-boot package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu4~18.04.1').
